ch.zhaw.iamp.rct.util

Class Storage

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.zhaw.iamp.rct.util.Storage

  • public class Storage
extends Object
    This Storage can be used to store Objects as simple files on the file system and read them again.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Storage(String storagePath)
      Creates a new Storage object that reads and writes the file at the given storagePath.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isExisting()
      Checks if a storage file at the configured storage path can be found or not.
      Object restore()
      Restores the object from the storage path.
      void store(Object objectToStore)
      Serializes and stores the given argument.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Storage

        public Storage(String storagePath)
        Creates a new Storage object that reads and writes the file at the given storagePath.
        Parameters:
        storagePath - The path of the target file of this Storage.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the argument is null or empty.

    • Method Detail

      • store

        public void store(Object objectToStore)
        Serializes and stores the given argument.
        Parameters:
        objectToStore - The object to store.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the argument is null.
        StorageException - If the argument could not be serialized or written.

      • restore

        public Object restore()
        Restores the object from the storage path.
        Returns:
        The restored object.
        Throws:
        StorageException - If anything goes wrong while restoring.

      • isExisting

        public boolean isExisting()
        Checks if a storage file at the configured storage path can be found or not. This does not test whether the file contains a serialized Java object, nor if it is of the correct type!
        Returns:
        True, if a storage file is existing, otherwise false.
